meanings.definition: relating to or derived from living matter
meanings.sent1: The soil in the forest is rich in organic nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the organic compounds found in plants.
meanings.sent3: The organic banana told a joke to the inorganic apple.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was as organic as the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent5: The organic growth of the flowers was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: of, relating to, or denoting compounds containing carbon and chiefly or ultimately of biological origin
meanings.sent1: The organic molecules in the body play a vital role in metabolism.
meanings.sent2: The chef used organic ingredients to prepare a healthy meal.
meanings.sent3: The organic chemistry class was full of lively discussions.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as organic as the elements in the periodic table.
meanings.sent5: The organic structure of the protein was essential for its function.

meanings.definition: of, relating to, or denoting food produced without the use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, or other artificial agents
meanings.sent1: She prefers to buy organic fruits and vegetables from the local market.
meanings.sent2: The organic farm prides itself on sustainable and eco-friendly practices.
meanings.sent3: The organic tomato refused to be sprayed with pesticides.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as pure and organic as the food they shared.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the organic honey was unlike anything she had ever tried.
